medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe fetal anomalies at 20 weeks’ gestation.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms were noted at 20 weeks’ gestation during an ultrasound, showing several fetal anomalies, including polyhydramnios, nuchal and general oedema, hepatomegaly, and general growth restriction. Previous pregnancies resulted in medically justified termination at 23 weeks due to severe fetal anomalies and a miscarriage at 9 weeks.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of medically justified termination for severe fetal anomalies at 23 weeks’ gestation in 2014 and a miscarriage at 9 weeks’ gestation in 2015.
medical_history.family_history: The patient and her partner had no similarly affected relatives and no history of consanguinity.
